0.title: CSK bowled out for lowest total of IPL 2022 against PBKS, lose 3 matches in a row
0.article_body: PBKS defeated CSK by 54 runs in their IPL 2022 encounter on Sunday. PBKS put up a total of 180/8 and bowled CSK out for 126 runs in 18 overs. CSK's 126 is the lowest total of IPL 2022 so far. CSK have now lost three matches in a row and they are currently ninth on the points table.

1.title: NIA conducts searches across 17 places in Assam, arrests 1 Naxal
1.article_body: The NIA on Sunday conducted searches at 17 locations across Assam and arrested a Naxal. The suspect had been absconding and was apprehended for allegedly spreading the network of CPI (Maoist) in the northeast region of the country. According to an official spokesperson of the NIA, the searches were carried out at places in Cachar, Karimganj, Dibrugarh and Dhubri districts.

2.title: Video shows Bharti Singh working a day before giving birth, fans praise her
2.article_body: A video of comedian Bharti Singh working on Saturday started doing the rounds online after she gave birth to her son on Sunday. The video showed Bharti and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa on the sets of a shoot. Many fans praised Singh with one saying, "What a rockstar", while another saying, "Commendable work ethics."

3.title: UP CM to launch 'School Chalo Abhiyan' in Shravasti on Monday
3.article_body: The 'School Chalo Abhiyan', aimed at ensuring 100% enrolment in primary and upper primary schools in Uttar Pradesh, will be launched by CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday. The programme is being started in the Shravasti district which has the lowest literacy rate in the state. According to the official release, the CM has told MLAs to adopt a school each.

4.title: US to give $50 million to Moldova to cope with Ukraine crisis
4.article_body: US will give an aid of $50 million to Ukraine's neighbouring Moldova to help the latter cope with impact of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, US Ambassador to UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield said on Sunday. The aid will support programmes, training and equipment for border management, she said. The US had earlier pledged $30 million to Moldova to assist refugee relief efforts.

5.title: After Gambhir, KKR under Shreyas is the team to beat in IPL: Irfan
5.article_body: Following Shreyas Iyer-led KKR's two wins from three matches in IPL 2022 so far, former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said KKR is looking "very solid" as far as the team's leadership is concerned. "After Gautam Gambhir, under Shreyas, this is the team to beat," he stated. Gambhir led KKR to two IPL titles in 2012 and 2014.

6.title: Hardik has put talks around his fitness to rest in IPL 2022: Swann
6.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said GT skipper Hardik Pandya is one of the main reasons for the franchise's two wins from two matches in IPL 2022. He added that the all-rounder has put all the talks about his fitness to rest by bowling quick. In both games, Hardik bowled his full quota of four overs and batted at number four.

7.title: Female patient dies in JP Hospital's washroom in MP's Bhopal
7.article_body: A 32-year-old female patient died in a washroom of a government district hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. Civil surgeon Dr Rakesh Srivastava confirmed that the patient died at JP Hospital on Saturday. While doctors maintain that the woman died of cardiac arrest, the hospital administration is waiting for the post mortem report to confirm the cause of death.

8.title: Couple robbed of car at gunpoint in Punjab's Amritsar, probe on
8.article_body: A couple was robbed of their car at gunpoint outside the Beant Singh Park in Punjab's Amritsar on Saturday. The victims, Ankur Kumar and his wife, were sitting in their parked Swift when three unknown persons approached them and pointed a pistol at them, police said, adding, "The miscreants snatched the car's key from the couple and drove it away."

9.title: MS Dhoni becomes second Indian to feature in 350 T20 matches
9.article_body: Former CSK captain MS Dhoni has become the second Indian cricketer to feature in 350 T20 matches. The CSK-PBKS IPL 2022 clash is Dhoni's 350th match in T20 cricket. MI captain Rohit Sharma has played the most number of T20 matches (372) among Indians. Rohit and Dhoni are followed by Suresh Raina, who has played 336 T20 matches.

10.title: Bezos shares pic of Amazon office from early days, says 'Big things start small'
10.article_body: The world's second-richest man Jeff Bezos on Sunday took to Instagram to share a picture of his office from Amazon's early days, and wrote, "Big things start small." The office had 'amazon.com' spray-painted on a banner and a table built out of a wooden door. He also shared a video of his company Blue Origin's fourth spaceflight with astronauts aboard.

11.title: All-round development being done without any bias: Haryana CM
11.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said his government is ensuring that "all-round development is being done in every sphere of the state without any bias". "There is no place for corruption in the state and those who indulge in such activities will not be spared," Khattar said after laying the foundation stone of 18 projects worth ₹135 crore.

12.title: Gujarat policeman caught slapping 13-yr-old boy on CCTV, suspended
12.article_body: A policeman, who was caught on CCTV slapping a 13-year-old boy in a marketplace in Gujarat's Vadodara, has been suspended for misconduct following an inquiry. The personnel, Shaktisinh Pvra, was travelling in his official vehicle "when he noticed the child muttering something at him...He got down, slapped the child several times and also twisted his arm", an official said.

13.title: Jordan's ex-Crown Prince gives up title a year after public rift
13.article_body: Jordan's ex-Crown Prince Hamzah bin Al Hussein on Sunday relinquished his princely title. In a letter, Prince Hamzah said he gave up his title because his values "are not in line with the...modern methods of our institutions". Notably, this comes a month after a royal court statement said he had apologised to the King for last year's aborted coup.

14.title: Explosion in Afghanistan's capital Kabul, at least 15 people injured
14.article_body: An explosion in centre of Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Sunday injured at least 15 people, said witnesses. However, the cause of the blast wasn't immediately clear. Reportedly, the blast occurred inside a market which was immediately closed after the blast and the Taliban surrounded the area. This comes despite the Taliban stepping up security since they assumed power last year.

15.title: CBI no more a 'caged parrot', it's truly performing its duty: Rijiju
15.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Sunday said, "CBI is no more a 'caged parrot' but truly performing its duty as India's top criminal investigating agency." He added that there was a time when "those who [sat] in the government" used to become a problem in investigations. Challenges faced by officers in the past are "no more in existence", he added.

16.title: 3 militants accused in murder case escape from jail in Tripura
16.article_body: Three trained militants, arrested in connection with the murder of businessman Litan Das, escaped from a jail in Tripura on Saturday. According to reports, the on-duty personnel at Kanchanpur sub-jail were busy opening the main entrance when they were overpowered by the undertrials. "An inquiry is underway...possible hideouts are being raided...to trace them as soon as possible," police said.

17.title: Officials capture leopard killing cattle in Assam's Golaghat
17.article_body: A wild leopard, which reportedly killed several cattle and goats, was captured in a cage by Forest Department staff in Assam's Golaghat district on Sunday. The leopard will be tranquilised and sent to the Centre for Wildlife Rehabilitation and Conservation, an official said, adding that at least 14 leopards have been caught in the area so far.

18.title: Sri Lanka PM office denies reports of PM's resignation amid economic crisis
18.article_body: Amid the economic crisis, Sri Lanka PM's Office has dismissed reports of PM Mahinda Rajapaksa’s resignation. Earlier, a media report mentioned possible resignations of the PM as well as Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa. Sri Lanka has declared a countrywide emergency amid escalating protests over the economic crisis that has led to a shortage of fuel, and food among other things.

19.title: Blasts heard in Russia's Belgorod near Ukrainian border: Report
19.article_body: Two explosions were heard in Russia's Belgorod near Ukrainian border on Sunday, witnesses reported. One of the witnesses added that the blasts were so powerful that they rattled the windows of her home in Belgorod. However, the cause of the blasts was not immediately clear. This comes days after Russia said two Ukrainian helicopters struck a fuel depot in Belgorod.

20.title: Ban on girls' education is damaging entire Afghanistan: UN chief
20.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres has expressed concern over the Taliban's move to keep high schools closed to girls, stating that such a ban will damage the entire country. Guterres added that the decision is an unjustifiable violation of equal rights. Taliban issued a decree last month banning girls studying in grade six and above from attending school until further orders.

21.title: Hate speech accused Narsinghanand speaks at 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' held in Delhi
21.article_body: The head priest of Ghaziabad's Dasna Devi Temple, Yati Narsinghanand, on Sunday spoke at a 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' held at New Delhi's Burari ground. In videos shared on social media, the Haridwar hate speech case accused, urged Hindus to take up arms. Delhi Police said the event's organisers did not have permission to hold it.

22.title: North Korea criticises South Korea's preemptive strike comments
22.article_body: Kim Yo-jong, the sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, has criticised South Korean Defence Minister Suh Wook for talking about preemptive strikes on North Korea. "South Korea may face a serious threat owing to...reckless remarks made by its Defence Minister," she said. Suh had said that South Korea has the readiness to launch strikes on North Korea.

23.title: Chandigarh was, is & will remain Haryana's capital: CM Khattar
23.article_body: Two days after the Punjab assembly passed a resolution seeking immediate transfer of Chandigarh to the state, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said that Chandigarh was and will remain Haryana's capital. "We will not let Chandigarh go anywhere. As long as the people of Haryana are with us, nothing can happen," he said.

24.title: Russia says it will suspend ISS cooperation until sanctions are lifted
24.article_body: The head of the Russian space agency Roscosmos, Dmitry Rogozin said that Russia will end cooperation on the ISS and will suspend its partnership with NASA and others until sanctions are lifted. Rogozin said the aim of the sanctions was to "kill the Russian economy and plunge our people into despair and hunger, to get our country on its knees."

25.title: Gary Oldman to appear in Nolan's 'Oppenheimer' for one scene
25.article_body: Actor Gary Oldman will be appearing in one scene of Christopher Nolan's upcoming film 'Oppenheimer'. Gary, speaking on a UK radio station, said he has to shoot for the film for one day. Gary has previously worked with Christopher Nolan in the 'Batman' trilogy. Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr, Emily Blunt and Rami Malek will also feature in the film.

26.title: Lithuania becomes 1st EU country to end Russian gas imports
26.article_body: Lithuania will no longer import gas from Russia to meet its domestic needs, becoming the first European Union (EU) member country to break its energy dependence on Moscow, the Lithuanian energy ministry said on Saturday. All gas for Lithuania's domestic consumption will be supplied via Klaipeda’s liquified natural gas (LNG) terminal. The terminal, called 'Independence', was inaugurated in 2014.

27.title: Russian forces committed 'massive abuses' in Ukraine, says France
27.article_body: France's Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian on Sunday condemned "massive abuses" committed by Russian forces in Ukraine in recent weeks. Local authorities have said that a deliberate "massacre" was carried out by Russian forces in Bucha, a town outside of the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv. The images coming from Bucha are "unbearable", French President Emmanuel Macron said in a tweet.

28.title: 11 Ukrainian mayors abducted by Russian forces: Deputy PM
28.article_body: Ukrainian Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Sunday claimed that 11 heads of communities in the regions of Kyiv, Kherson, Kharkiv, Zaporizhzhia, Mykolaiv and Donetsk are in captivity since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. Vereshchuk added that Olga Sukhenko, head of Motyjin village and her husband had been "killed in captivity" by Russian soldiers.

29.title: More than 90 migrants drown in Mediterranean Sea: Report
29.article_body: Doctors Without Borders (MSF) on Saturday said that more than 90 migrants in an overcrowded boat drowned in the Mediterranean Sea. As per MSF, the migrants were on a vessel that left Libya last week. Meanwhile, UN's International Organization for Migration said nearly 300 migrants died or were presumed dead along Central Mediterranean route between January 1 and March 28.

30.title: Man catches 'living dinosaur' fish weighing 159 kg in Canada river, shares video
30.article_body: A man in Canada's Alberta shared a video of an 8 feet 6 inches long sturgeon fish, also known as the 'living dinosaur', that weighed about 159 kilograms. Braeden Rouse reeled the massive fish in from the Fraser River. Rouse said the fish took him a kilometre downstream before he landed her.

31.title: Wishes are more than enough: Arjun Bijlani on pic of fan who tattooed his face
31.article_body: Arjun Bijlani took to Instagram to share a picture of his fan who got the actor's face tattooed on his arm, and wrote, "Unbelievable. Lots of love." However, Bijlani added, "It's humbling when fans show so much love but I really wish they wouldn't put themselves in such pain." He said, "Their messages and their wishes are more than enough."

32.title: WhatsApp banned over 14 lakh Indian accounts in Feb 2022: Report
32.article_body: WhatsApp banned 14,26,000 India-based accounts in February 2022 based on grievances received from users via the instant messaging platform's grievance mechanism, according to WhatsApp's ninth monthly user safety report. Additionally, accounts that violated Indian laws or WhatsApp's terms of services were also banned. WhatsApp had earlier banned 18.58 lakh Indian accounts in January 2022.

33.title: Ranbir will undergo body transformation for 'Animal': Fitness coach
33.article_body: Fitness coach Shivohaam has said actor Ranbir Kapoor will undergo "some kind of" body transformation for his upcoming film 'Animal'. "He told me that he will give me the brief soon...In the first schedule he said, they are not going to reveal much, probably that will be in the latter part," he stated. Sandeep Reddy Vanga will direct the film.

34.title: Patidar joins RCB squad as a replacement for injured Sisodia in IPL 2022
34.article_body: RCB have signed Rajat Patidar, who had previously represented the franchise four times, as a replacement for injured Luvnith Sisodia for remainder of IPL 2022. The 28-year-old right-handed batter will join RCB for ₹20 lakh. Patidar represents Madhya Pradesh in domestic cricket and has so far played 31 T20s, scoring 861 runs. RCB will face RR on Tuesday.

35.title: BJP, Cong criticise Delhi govt for allowing 25% discount on liquor
35.article_body: BJP and Congress on Saturday criticised the Delhi government for allowing liquor stores to offer up to 25% discount. Delhi Congress president Anil Kumar said that the government allowed the discount on liquor to "hurt the sentiments" of people observing Navratri. Delhi BJP spokesperson Praveen Shankar Kapoor said that such a scheme would increase liquor consumption amongst the youngsters.

36.title: Punjab to recruit 10,500 teachers to fill shortage of staff: Minister
36.article_body: The Punjab government will recruit 10,500 teachers soon to fill the shortage of teaching staff, Education Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer said on Sunday. "AAP government in Punjab led by Bhagwant Singh Mann is committed to transforming education as well as sports scenarios in the state in letter and spirit," Hayer further said.

37.title: 324 K'taka govt employees found holding illegal BPL cards, fined
37.article_body: Government employees found holding illegal BPL cards in Karnataka's Dharwad are being searched and fined. The HRMS data revealed there are 324 such employees, of which 24 have already been fined and a total fine of ₹7,08,000 has been collected. While the remaining 300 are yet to pay the fine, all such employees' cards have been cancelled to avoid misuse.

38.title: He's pure talent, made for T20 format: Shastri on Gill's best-ever IPL score
38.article_body: Praising Shubman Gill after he achieved his best-ever IPL score (46-ball 84) in GT's last match in IPL 2022, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said the 22-year-old opener is "pure talent" and is made for T20 format. "Once he gets going he'll score and...makes it look easy. He's got that punch...time and...power to play along the ground," he added.

39.title: 2 people injured in train derailment near Maharashtra's Nashik
39.article_body: Two passengers have reportedly been injured in a train derailment near Nashik in Maharashtra. The Central Railway on Sunday said that both victims suffered minor injuries and were given primary treatment. An official said that a body was found near the railway track but it is not a passenger and is thought to have been there before the derailment.

40.title: Russia must pay for 'war crimes' in Ukraine's Bucha: Germany
40.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said on Sunday that Russia must pay for its "war crimes" in Ukraine's Bucha in the form of more severe sanctions. "Images from Bucha are unbearable, Putin's rampant violence is wiping out innocent families and knows no boundaries," she tweeted. Almost 300 people have been buried in mass graves in Bucha, its mayor has said.

41.title: Terrorists shoot at 2 men from Punjab in J&K's Pulwama district
41.article_body: Terrorists shot at and injured two men from Punjab in the Pulwama district of Jammu and Kashmir on Sunday, police said. The men were injured in the attack at Nowpora in the Litter area of Pulwama, the police added. They were shifted to the district hospital in Pulwama, from where one of them was referred to SMHS hospital in Srinagar.

42.title: Sexual harassment accused paraded with garland of shoes in Assam
42.article_body: A man who allegedly molested a seven-year-old minor girl in Assam was made to walk through an entire village wearing a garland of footwear. The incident took place in the Kathonibari area in Biswanath district where a group of villagers also allegedly thrashed him and painted his face. The accused, identified as 56-year-old Mohim Bora, was arrested by police.

43.title: Halal meat issue being raised to disturb peace: Siddaramaiah
43.article_body: Congress leader and former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah said the halal meat issue is being made out to be a major issue to disturb the peace in society. "These are not issues that are relevant to people or the lives of people," Siddaramaiah said. "Do we not buy halal meat and eat it? We eat it often," he added.

44.title: 2 arrested for possessing banned sea cucumbers in TN's Rameswaram
44.article_body: Two people were arrested near Tamil Nadu's Serankottai beach by Rameswaram Coastal Security Wing for allegedly possessing sea cucumbers. The fishery of sea cucumbers is banned in India and they are protected under Wildlife (Protection) Act. The accused have been booked for hunting and procuring the endangered species, which is consumed in some parts of the world.

45.title: Technical problem shuts most of rail network in Netherlands
45.article_body: The Dutch national railway operator NS on Sunday announced that most of the rail network in the country was shut down due to an unspecified technical problem. "We are working hard on a recovery but, alas, we cannot now say how long this situation will persist," it said. The regional trains in the Netherlands are still running, it added.

46.title: MS Dhoni pulls off diving run out after running at top speed of 23 kmph, video goes viral
46.article_body: CSK's 40-year-old wicketkeeper MS Dhoni pulled off a run out with a dive after running at a top speed of 23 kmph during their IPL 2022 match against PBKS. CSK pacer Chris Jordan missed a direct hit after Bhanuka Rajapaksa was sent back by Shikhar Dhawan. Dhoni sprinted and collected the ball before executing the dive and running Rajapaksa out.

47.title: Any BBL team would love to have a player like Babar Azam: Finch
47.article_body: Australia white-ball skipper Aaron Finch said if Pakistan captain Babar Azam decides to participate in Big Bash League (BBL), Australia's domestic cricket league, any team would "love" to have him. "I just asked Babar if he's interested in coming and playing for Melbourne Renegades and he certainly is–and hopefully, we can announce that signing tomorrow!" Finch joked.

48.title: J&K Police bust 2 terror modules, arrest 5 LeT associates in Bandipora
48.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Sunday busted two terror modules and arrested five terror associates linked with the Lashkar-e-Taiba from the Bandipora district. The five accused, who were caught in separate incidents, were reportedly nabbed while providing logistics and transportation to the terrorist group. At least three Chinese grenades were also retrieved from the accused's possession.

49.title: Bhumi to star in Karan Boolani's 'Thank You For Coming': Report
49.article_body: Bhumi Pednekar will reportedly star in 'Thank You For Coming', which will mark Karan Boolani's directorial debut. "Film is produced by Rhea Kapoor under her banner and is in conversation with another...producer to come on board as...studio partner," a source stated. The source added that the title and cast of the film will be announced once the shoot is completed.

50.title: No insecurities: Jr NTR on Ram getting more screen time in 'RRR'
50.article_body: Actor Jr NTR, talking about Ram Charan getting more screen time in 'RRR', has said, "I...am aware of the fact...SS Rajamouli (director) has given equal importance to both Ram and Bheem roles." Jr NTR further said that there were no insecurities involved with Ram and added, "We both complimented each other beautifully."

51.title: Russian troops given poisoned food & alcohol by Ukrainian civilians: Officials
51.article_body: Two Russian troops were killed and many were injured after being given poisoned food and alcohol by civilians in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, Ukrainian officials said. Some 28 Russian troops were in intensive care, while another 500 were taken to hospitals due to heavy alcohol poisoning, they added. Ukrainian civilians were resisting the Russian forces by all available means, officials said.

52.title: Zeke Smith proposes to Nico Santos onstage at GLAAD Media Awards
52.article_body: Television personality Zeke Smith proposed to actor Nico Santos onstage during the 2022 GLAAD Media Awards on Saturday. "Nico, your love has taught me how to love...I want to spend the rest of my life with you," Zeke said. The couple first met in 2018 at the GLAAD Media Awards and made their relationship social media official two months later.

53.title: 20-yr-old UP woman kills self after objectionable pics posted online
53.article_body: A 20-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur allegedly killed herself by consuming poison after her objectionable pictures were posted online by some men. Four people, including the main accused, have been arrested. The girl had reportedly filed a complaint but no action was taken. A police constable has been suspended for the alleged negligence.

54.title: My mom has 21 cousins in Iran, want to take her there for next film's shoot: John
54.article_body: Actor John Abraham told Pinkvilla, "My next film is called 'Tehran'...and I will be shooting in Iran." He added, "My mom (Firoza Irani) has got 21 cousins in Iran and I want to go and shoot there and I want to take her there." He added, "She wants to meet some of them so I'm very excited about going there."

55.title: We don't own a house, my only aim is to get a house for my parents with IPL salary: Tilak
55.article_body: MI's 19-year-old batting-allrounder Tilak Varma, who scored 61(33) against RR, has said that his family doesn't own a house as yet. He added, "With whatever I have earned in this IPL, my only aim is to get a house for my parents. This IPL money gives me the luxury to play freely for the rest of my career," he added.

56.title: India’s position on Russia-Ukraine conflict consistent: President
56.article_body: India's position on the ongoing conflict in Ukraine has been steadfast and consistent, said President Ram Nath Kovind. "We have emphasised that the current global order is anchored in international law, the UN Charter and respect for territorial integrity and sovereignty of states," the President added. He further said, "We are deeply concerned about the worsening humanitarian situation."

57.title: Ukraine shows dead bodies, corpse with tied hands appears to be shot in mouth
57.article_body: Ukrainian city Bucha's mayor Anatoly Fedoruk showed journalists the dead bodies in an area that, he said, Chechen fighters controlled during the month that Russian forces occupied the city. "One corpse appeared to have hands bound by a white cloth...and to have been shot in the mouth," Reuters reported. "Russians have demonstrated that they were consciously killing civilians," Fedoruk said.

58.title: 6 dead, 10 injured in mass shooting in US' Sacramento: Police
58.article_body: A mass shooting in California's Sacramento has killed six people and left 10 others injured, according to the police. Authorities don't know the number of suspects involved in the shooting and have asked for the public's help in identifying the suspects. This is "a very complex and complicated scene", Sacramento Police Chief Kathy Lester said.

59.title: A 'potentate' has unleashed nuclear war threat: Pope on Ukraine crisis
59.article_body: A "potentate" (an autocratic monarch) has unleashed the threat of nuclear war on the world, Pope Francis said in an implicit criticism of Russian President Vladimir Putin amid Ukraine's invasion. Calling the invasion "savage", Pope stated that the "potentate" was engaging in conflict for nationalist gains. "We...thought that invasions...and atomic threats were grim memories of...past," he added.

60.title: Man stabs landlord to death in Gujarat, arrested within 15 mins
60.article_body: A man allegedly stabbed his landlord to death with a knife in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Saturday following an argument over rent. The accused fled after the incident but was arrested within 15 minutes. The patrolling unit had reportedly become suspicious after finding him with bloodstains after which they brought him back to the area where he was identified by locals.

61.title: Missing teacher's body found in a pond with hands & legs tied in UP
61.article_body: The body of a 42-year-old teacher was recovered from a pond in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi district, with his hands and legs tied up, a day after he went missing, police said. According to the complaint lodged by the family, the deceased had a property dispute. He left his home on Saturday evening after a phone call, the report added.

62.title: Police recover crude bombs from a football ground in WB's Birbhum
62.article_body: The police recovered crude bombs in a plastic bag near a ground in Sikandarpur village of West Bengal's Birbhum district on Sunday. "A bomb squad team of CID was called to defuse the bombs," said Birbhum Superintendent of Police Nagendra Nath Tripathi. Raids were conducted as part of the 10-day drive to unearth illegal arms and ammunition in the state.

63.title: High time we understand it's 1 film industry, not categories: Yash
63.article_body: 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' actor Yash at a press meet stated that it is high time we understand that it is one film industry and stopped classifying Indian cinema into subcategories. "If today...I will come to Bombay and make a film for every part of this country...it just can't be a Hindi film. It will be an Indian film," he added.

64.title: 'Operation Romeo' about moral policing experienced by all: Producer
64.article_body: 'Operation Romeo' producer Neeraj Pandey has stated that everyone has experienced moral policing of varying intensities at least once in their lives. "That's the reason we thought to make a film on it. The plot is intense and based on a specific incident," he added. It is helmed by Shashant Shah and features Bhumika Chawla, Sidhant Gupta and Sharad Kelkar.

65.title: To bowl with 'boom boom' Bumrah in nets has been special: MI's Meredith
65.article_body: MI pacer Riley Meredith said bowling in the nets with teammate Jasprit Bumrah has been "special" for him in IPL 2022. "At the moment, it's hard to get past the big 'boom boom' Bumrah...he's a great fellow and is more than happy to share some tricks with me," he added. Meredith hasn't featured in any match for MI so far.

66.title: Naga Babu's daughter among 144 detained at Hyd rave party, cocaine seized
66.article_body: Around 144 people, including actor Naga Babu Konidela's daughter and actress Niharika, were detained in a drugs raid at a rave party in an upscale pub in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills. Five packets of cocaine were found during the raid, police said. The winner of the third season of Bigg Boss Telugu Rahul Sipligunj and several politicians' children were also detained.

67.title: No Pakistani Prime Minister has ever completed a full 5-yr term in office
67.article_body: In Pakistan’s history, no Prime Minister has ever completed a full 5-year term in office. While the first PM Liaquat Ali Khan, was assassinated, others left due to the imposition of martial law or their governments getting dissolved. Notably, the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan was rejected and fresh elections will be held in 90 days.

68.title: Shia LaBeouf and partner Mia Goth welcome their first baby
68.article_body: Actor Shia LeBeouf and his partner model-actress Mia Goth have welcomed their first baby together. While they haven't made an official announcement, the couple was seen pushing a baby stroller in Los Angeles on Friday. Shia and Mia were previously married from 2016 to 2018 before separating amicably. They later rekindled their relationship and quarantined together during the COVID-19 lockdown.

69.title: My Insta account is probably hacked, beware of unusual activity: Yami
69.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, taking to Twitter on Sunday, has said that she has been unable to access her Instagram account. "It's probably hacked. We're trying to recover it as soon as possible," she added. "If there is any unusual activity through my account, please be aware of it," the actress further stated.

70.title: India to send 5 more aid consignments to Sri Lanka till May
70.article_body: India will send five more consignments of aid to Sri Lanka till May amid a severe economic crisis, Gopal Baglay, the Indian High Commissioner to the South Asian country, announced. Four consignments totaling over 1,50,000 tonnes of jet fuel, diesel and petrol have been delivered by India since March, he said. Currently, Sri Lanka has imposed a curfew.

71.title: Exorcist arrested for beating, scorching 14-yr-old in Jharkhand
71.article_body: An exorcist was arrested in Jharkhand's Chatra district for allegedly beating up a 14-year-old girl and scorching her with incense sticks to "ward off evil spirits," police said on Sunday. The girl had fallen sick after Holi and the accused assured her family that she would get better through exorcism, police said.

72.title: Videos of kangaroos roaming on West Bengal roads go viral; probe launched
72.article_body: Videos of kangaroos purportedly roaming on the roads of West Bengal have gone viral on social media. Responding to one of such videos, IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted, "They are part of smuggling." Divisional Forest Officer Hari Krishnan called the spottings "unusual", adding that a probe has been launched to investigate how and from where the animals reached nearby forests.

73.title: I'm partially to blame for centralising the internet: Twitter ex-CEO Dorsey
73.article_body: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey expressed his regrets for the current state of the internet and said, "I realise I'm partially to blame." Referring to earlier online communications systems, Dorsey tweeted, "The days of usenet, irc [Internet Relay Chat], the web...even email (w PGP)...were amazing. Centralising discovery and identity into corporations really damaged the internet."

74.title: Goa CM retains Home & Finance Depts as portfolios allocated in new Cabinet
74.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Sunday allocated portfolios to his eight Cabinet colleagues and retained the Home and Finance Ministries. Sawant also holds the Personnel and Vigilance portfolios. Rohan Khaunte, who joined BJP ahead of the state Assembly polls, will handle Tourism and Information Technology departments among others. Vishwajit Rane retained Health and Women and Child Development portfolios.

75.title: I'm not getting to go to the Grammys, I'm slammed this month: Miranda
75.article_body: Singer Miranda Lambert said she'll be missing the 64th Grammy Awards due to her hectic schedule following the release of her new album and upcoming tour. "I'm not getting to go again...I'm slammed this month, with the record coming out and everything," she stated. Lambert is nominated for Best Country Duo/Group Performance and Best Country Album in this year's Grammys.

76.title: FPIs withdraw ₹41,000 cr in Mar, become net sellers for 6th month
76.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹41,123 crore from the Indian equity market in March 2022. With this, FPIs became net sellers for the sixth consecutive month, having withdrawn net ₹1.48 lakh crore between October 2021 and March 2022. Apart from equities, the debt segment witnessed net outflows of ₹5,632 crore in March.

77.title: Unemployment rate dropping in India, fell to 7.6% in March: CMIE
77.article_body: India's unemployment rate is decreasing and fell to 7.6% in March 2022, the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy's (CMIE) data showed. The unemployment ratio further dropped to 7.5% on April 2, with urban unemployment at 8.5% and rural at 7.1%. Haryana recorded the highest unemployment rate in March at 26.7%, while Gujarat and Karnataka recorded the lowest at 1.8%.

78.title: CSK to bowl first against PBKS after winning their 1st toss in IPL 2022, playing XIs out
78.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain Ravindra Jadeja won his first toss in IPL 2022 and elected to bowl first against PBKS. CSK have made one change to their playing XI, with Chris Jordan replacing Tushar Deshpande. PBKS have made two changes to their playing XI, with Vaibhav Arora and Jitesh Sharma replacing Harpreet Brar and Raj Bawa.

79.title: Pune diesel prices rise to ₹100.60 per litre after 11th hike in 13 days
79.article_body: The diesel prices in Pune crossed the ₹100 per litre mark on Sunday after the 11th hike in prices in 13 days. The diesel in the city now costs ₹100.60 per litre, a rise of 83 paise from April 2, while petrol costs ₹117.87 per litre. The diesel price in Mumbai has been increased to ₹102.64 per litre from ₹101.79/litre.

80.title: Millionaire YouTuber Logan Paul wears most expensive Pokemon card at WWE debut
80.article_body: Millionaire YouTuber Logan Paul, who made his WWE WrestleMania debut recently, wore the world’s most expensive Pokemon card as a necklace. Paul wore a PSA Grade 10 Pikachu Illustrator card that he bought last year for $5,275,000 (around ₹40 crore). Paul's Pikachu card is one of the rarest Pokemon cards as only 39 of those exist in the world.

81.title: I've always wanted to represent India globally: Ranveer Singh
81.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has stated that he has always wanted to represent India globally. He added that as an actor he can represent the country and its universal themes with his work to millions of people across the world. "I find that humbling," Ranveer said. He further stated we are on the cusp of getting recognition on a global scale.

82.title: Didn't realise how good a player Moeen is until he joined CSK: Hussey
82.article_body: Speaking about Moeen Ali's batting, CSK batting coach Michael Hussey said the CSK all-rounder is an "unbelievable player and a beautiful batter". He added, "I only watched him closely for...first time when he joined CSK squad in the last season...I didn't realise [until then] how good a player he actually is." Moeen scored 35 runs off 22 balls against LSG.

83.title: We deserved a victory today: Lanning on Aus winning 2022 Women's WC
83.article_body: After Australia defeated England by 71 runs and won 2022 Women's World Cup title, Australia captain Meg Lanning said her side deserved the victory on Sunday. "We've been extremely consistent over a long period of time," she added. Australia didn't lose a single match in tournament, winning nine games on the trot. It is Australia's record-extending seventh World Cup title.

84.title: Delhi Police's IFSO unit arrests 8 for Chinese loan app fraud
84.article_body: Eight people were arrested by Delhi Police's Intelligence Fusion and Strategic Operations (IFSO) unit for abusing and extorting money from customers of a Chinese loan application. A complainant claimed that the abuse and extortion had taken place despite the repayment of the loan. The customers would receive threatening calls and text messages as part of the abuse, the police said.

85.title: Hyd Police arrests 3 people, seize gutka & tobacco worth over ₹17,500
85.article_body: Hyderabad Police apprehended three people on Friday and seized gutka and tobacco worth ₹17,579 from their possession. The accused, who had the materials in their possession in order to deliver them to customers at Mahadev Kirana & General Store, near Bowenpally check post, were nabbed by Bowenpally Police. They were caught based on a tip-off following a surprise check.

86.title: I like watching Rohit Sharma, he has aggressive nature: Odean
86.article_body: West Indies all-rounder Odean Smith has said that Rohit Sharma is the Indian player he admires the most. "Rohit is one of those players with (amazing) batting speed. He has a very aggressive nature and I would like to take that (aspect of his batting) in my game also," he stated. Odean further said, "I like watching him."

87.title: No penalty for not wearing face masks inside Delhi Metro
87.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) on Sunday said no penalty will be imposed on passengers who are not wearing face masks while travelling in metro. "As per Delhi Disaster Management Authority guidelines, it is advised to follow COVID-19 appropriate behaviour like wearing of mask, hand sanitisation, etc," DMRC said in response to a query by a Twitter user.

88.title: Not keen on becoming UPA chief or leading anti-BJP front: Pawar
88.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar said on Sunday that he isn't keen on becoming United Progressive Alliance's (UPA) chairperson or leading anti-BJP front. Pawar, however, stated that he's supportive of the formation of such an alliance, adding that Congress should be included in it. Pawar's comments came after NCP's youth wing proposed his name for UPA chief's post.

89.title: New scheme plans to set up 'Hobby Hubs' in Delhi govt schools
89.article_body: The Directorate of Education (DoE) in Delhi plans to set up 'Hobby Hubs' in government schools for the 2022-2023 academic session, according to a report in The Indian Express. However, this project will only be implemented in single-shift government schools. The DoE will invite applications from interested academies to execute the project in schools, the report said.

90.title: Cyberabad Traffic Police educates students about road safety
90.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police on Friday conducted a road safety awareness drive in the town of Chevella. As per the force's official Twitter handle, Chevella Traffic Inspector G Guruvayya educated students about traffic rules at the Chevella bus stop. A group of students was told about the dangers and penalties for minor driving, rash driving and driving without a licence.

91.title: PCMC's building permission dept collects record ₹1,036-cr revenue in 2021-22
91.article_body: The building permission department of the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation generated a record ₹1,036 crore in revenue in the 2021-22 financial year. "The building permission department has never registered such a high collection in the past," Joint City Engineer Makrand Nikam said. Among other works, the department is responsible for issuing necessary permits for all kinds of buildings.

92.title: Mumbai man chats nude on dating app; blackmailed to pay ₹10,000
92.article_body: A 24-year-old from Mumbai's Andheri (East) was blackmailed to pay ₹10,000 via GPay after he chatted nude with a woman he met on a dating app. The victim joined a video call with the accused and removed his clothes upon seeing the girl nude. He later received a video saying it would be made viral if he doesn't pay ₹10,000.

93.title: Time running out, people must be protected: Sangakkara on Sri Lanka crisis
93.article_body: Former Sri Lankan cricketer Kumar Sangakkara took to Facebook to share his thoughts on the Sri Lankan economic crisis and emergency. "Sri Lankans are going through one of the toughest times imaginable," he wrote. "The people aren't the enemy, Sri Lanka is its people...Time is fast running out...the people and their future must be protected and provided for," he added.

94.title: Delhi Police arrests 110, recover 220 gms of ganja in last 24 hrs
94.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 110 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 220 grams of ganja in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 12 proclaimed offenders, seized 392 litres of illicit liquor and recovered 12 stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 4,685 calls, the post added.

95.title: 17-yr-old kills father in Pune, hangs body to pass off as suicide
95.article_body: Pune Police on Saturday detained a 17-year-old boy for allegedly throttling his father to death and hanging his body on an iron pole outside their house to pass it off as a case of suicide. The boy allegedly killed his father because he suspected his mother's character and harassed her over this issue, the report said.

96.title: IFS officer posts pic of 'meditating owl', says 'it has the perfect camouflage'
96.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Susanta Nanda posted a picture of a 'meditating owl' on a tree and said, "[It] has the perfect camouflage that one can ever see." The picture quickly gained traction with many users trying to spot the camouflaged bird. "Even I had to meditate for a few seconds to make it visible," said one user.

97.title: Bharti Singh and Haarsh Limbachiyaa become parents, welcome a baby boy
97.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh and her producer-husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa on Sunday took to social media to announce that they've become parents and welcomed a baby boy. The couple shared a picture of themselves that had "It's a boy" written on it. Earlier this week, Bharti Singh had refuted rumours that she had welcomed her first child, a baby girl.

98.title: MNS leader arrested for playing Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers in Mumbai
98.article_body: MNS leader Mahendra Bhanushali was arrested on Sunday for playing Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers without permission in Mumbai. "They have taken away my amplifier. But I would like to say, in coming times, 'Jai Shree Ram' will be played on loudspeakers," Bhanushali said following his arrest. Earlier, Hanuman Chalisa was played on loudspeakers at Maharashtra Navnirman Sena office in Ghatkopar.

99.title: Raj govt failed to maintain law & order: Shekhawat on Karauli clashes
99.article_body: Reacting to communal clashes in Rajasthan's Karauli on Saturday, Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said that state government has failed to maintain law and order. "If people are being attacked...for celebrating...Indian New Year in India...it's a matter of concern," he added. At least 25 people were left injured after clashes broke out following stone-pelting at a bike rally in Karauli.

100.title: Russian forces preventing Ukrainian resupply by Black Sea: UK
100.article_body: UK Military Intelligence on Sunday said Russia naval forces continue to blockade the Ukrainian coast on the Black Sea and Sea of Azov, preventing resupply by sea. As per the update, Russian forces retain the ability to launch an amphibious landing. However, it said  mines within the Black Sea pose a serious risk to maritime activity.

101.title: I'm greedy actor, want to tell stories irrespective of medium: Vidya
101.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has called herself a greedy actor, saying that she just wants to tell stories and connect to people irrespective of any medium. She further said that she doesn't have any method to choose a script and picks them instinctively. "We are in a day and age where some films will work and some won't," the actress added.

102.title: BTS' Jungkook recovers from COVID-19, to perform at Grammys
102.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS member Jungkook has recovered from COVID-19 and will be performing at the 2022 Grammys ceremony in US' Las Vegas, his management agency announced on Sunday. The singer had tested negative for COVID-19 before departing from South Korea but tested positive after landing in US. Jungkook has been under quarantine since March 27.

103.title: You need confidence after losing 1st match: Babar on ODI series win vs Aus
103.article_body: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam has credited his players for the 2-1 ODI series win against Australia. "You need confidence after losing the first game. Credit goes to the players as they took responsibility and showed good efforts," Azam said. He adds, "When you get early wickets, there is pressure on the opposition. Almost every bowler of ours executed their plans."

104.title: Ozone may be weakening one of Earth's vital cooling mechanisms: Study
104.article_body: A group of international researchers warned ozone may be weakening one of Earth's most important cooling mechanisms. The study revealed that ozone levels in upper and lower atmosphere were responsible for almost a third of the warming in the Southern Ocean. Team used models to simulate changes in ozone levels in the upper and lower atmosphere between 1955 and 2000.

105.title: Poland would like a 50% increase in US troops in Europe: Deputy PM
105.article_body: Polish Deputy PM Jaroslaw Kaczynski on Sunday said Poland would be pleased if US increased its number of troops by 50% in Europe. "Of these, 75,000 soldiers should be stationed on the eastern flank, 50,000 soldiers in the Baltic states, Poland," the leader of the ruling party added. Reportedly, 80,000 US troops were stationed in Europe before Russians entered Ukraine.

106.title: Our team sets out to win events like World Cup: Alyssa Healy
106.article_body: After winning their seventh Women's World Cup, Australian wicketkeeper-batter Alyssa Healy said that her team "sets out to win events like these (World Cup)". "Everyone is sort of keen to get out there and do just that," Healy said. She also said that she "never imagined in her wildest dreams" of scoring 170 in the World Cup final against England.

107.title: UN Human Rights Council names Tuvalu negotiator as climate expert
107.article_body: UN Human Rights Council on Friday appointed Tuvalu negotiator Ian Fry an expert on climate change and human rights for first time on Friday. The new independent expert is required to study and identify how the adverse effects of climate change affect the full and effective enjoyment of human rights. Fry has been appointed for a period of three years.

108.title: Fire breaks out at Kanpur's Rave Moti Mall, no injury reported
108.article_body: A fire broke out at Kanpur's Rave Moti Mall, where a huge number of people had come, on Sunday. No injury was reported so far, Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police (West) Brijesh Srivastava said, adding six fire tenders were on spot. The fire on first floor was under control and efforts were underway to douse the flames on second floor.

109.title: India's exports touch record high of $417.8 bn in FY22, govt calls it 'historic'
109.article_body: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday announced that India's exports touched a record high of $417.8 billion in FY22, and called the milestone "historic". "It's the first time that the country's yearly exports have reached this figure and the exports were 5% above the set target," Goyal said. Goods worth $40 billion were exported in March 2022 alone.

110.title: You don't know which Punjab will turn up: Parthiv ahead of PBKS vs CSK
110.article_body: Ahead of PBKS-CSK in IPL 2022, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said PBKS are playing the same way despite having overhauled the set-up. "You don't know which Punjab will turn up- the 200-run...or 120-run Punjab because such is the style of play," he added. PBKS have played two matches so far, winning and losing one each. Match will be played today.

111.title: Congratulations for yet another WC: Jaffer after Aus Women's 7th title
111.article_body: Following Australia's record-extending seventh Women's World Cup title in Christchurch, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "Congratulations to Australia Women for winning yet another World Cup...commiserations to England." Australia Test captain Pat Cummins tweeted, "Congratulations to Meg [Lanning], Motty [Matthew Mott] and the team. Huge. What a win and tournament, enjoy accordingly."

112.title: Mumbai Police band plays 'Happy B'day' for kid amid 'Sunday Streets'
112.article_body: A team from Khaki Studio, the Mumbai Police's band, which was present during the 'Sunday Streets' event in the city, was seen playing the 'Happy Birthday' tune for a child celebrating his birthday amid the gathering. In a video uploaded on Instagram, the child can be seen cutting his birthday cake while the tune is played by the band.

113.title: I am exhausted: Singer Camila on being stalked by photographers for bikini pics
113.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello took to Instagram to share a post on her body image struggles and how photographers stalk her to get her bikini pictures when she goes to the beach. Adding that she is exhausted, Camila said that photographers even hide in the bushes sometimes to get pictures. She further said it has impacted her self esteem.

114.title: People not having kids in the first place is a problem: Elon Musk
114.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk, who has raised concerns about the falling birth rate in the past, on Sunday tweeted, "Humanity did not evolve to mourn the unborn...But we should...I'm talking about not having kids in the first place. That's the problem." He also responded to a picture of Nikola Tesla by tweeting, "He never had even one kid."

115.title: Russian troops selling items looted from Ukraine in Belarus: Ukraine ministry
115.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry has shared a social media post on how Russian troops have opened a market in Belarus to sell goods stolen from houses in Ukraine during the invasion. The ministry said they have been selling washing machines, children's toys, cosmetics, cars, dishes and jewellery, among other things. They are also trying to exchange looted currency, it added.

116.title: Over 600 arrested in Sri Lanka's Western Province for violating curfew
116.article_body: Sri Lanka on Sunday arrested 664 protesters in the country's Western Province for violating a 36-hour-long curfew that has been imposed amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. The arrests were made ahead of planned 'Arab Spring' style protests across country, which were held later today. Sri Lanka is grappling with a shortage of essential items and rolling power cuts.

117.title: Would've been nice had I stayed to finish the game vs RR: MI's Tilak
117.article_body: Mumbai Indians batter Tilak Varma, reacting to his knock against Rajasthan Royals, said, "I'm very happy to know...I have become the youngest MI player to score a fifty." Despite Tilak's 33-ball 61 runs, Rajasthan defeated Mumbai by 23 runs. "It would've been nice had I stayed to finish the game. I'll try to do so in upcoming matches," he added.

118.title: India beat England 3-2 on penalties in FIH Pro League game
118.article_body: India defeated England 3-2 in penalty shoot-out after the English team scored an equaliser with just 12 seconds remaining in the FIH Men's Hockey Pro League match in Bhubaneswar on Saturday. Both teams finished at 3-3 leading to the shoot-outs which India won in their seventh shoot-out attempt. Defender Harmanpreet Singh was adjudged as the 'Player of the Match'.

119.title: I'm mature player now: Imam-Ul-Haq after ODI series win vs Australia
119.article_body: After scoring unbeaten 89 runs in a nine-wicket win over Australia in the third ODI, Pakistan batter Imam-Ul-Haq said, "I'm a mature player now. Working hard from last one and a half years." Talking about winning the ODI series, he said, "The way boys came back from the first match comes down to the self-belief...trust we have in each other."

120.title: BMC to set up solar-powered poles in Mumbai to save electricity
120.article_body: BMC will set up solar power electric poles resembling trees in Mumbai as part of its tactical urbanism plan. Each pole will have five high-power LED lights and "will be able to save up to 35% of daily consumption of regular electricity", according to officials. "The primary objective is...to spread awareness about...clean and renewable energy," the project in-charge said.

121.title: Praggnanandhaa can become future world champion: Viswanathan Anand
121.article_body: Five-time world champion Viswanathan Anand said he feels that 16-year-old chess Grandmaster Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa can become a "world champion" in the future. "It's a big deal to beat... Magnus Carlsen. Praggnanandhaa has done it, so he has got talent," Anand said. "I am working with some young talents including Praggnanandhaa...All have the potential...[to] become World Champions," he added.

122.title: RS played crucial role in strengthening parliamentary democracy: Naidu
122.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday said that the Rajya Sabha has played a "crucial role in strengthening parliamentary democracy". "I would like to appeal to the members of Rajya Sabha to engage in informed and constructive debates by keeping the welfare of the people in mind," the Vice President said.

123.title: Argument over WhatsApp chat claims man's life in Kerala
123.article_body: An argument while chatting on WhatsApp led to a 42-year-old man getting killed in Kerala’s Pathanamthitta district on Saturday. According to the police, the deceased, Ranjith, was a newspaper agent who got into a scuffle with his neighbour Anil (43) on March 27 over a WhatsApp conversation. During the brawl, Ranjith suffered a fatal head injury, police said.

124.title: Video shows rescue of woman smuggled in duffel bag from a burning car in US
124.article_body: A video has been shared by the police in the US which captured the moment when a woman, who was stuffed in a duffel bag, was rescued from a burning car. While the bodycam footage captured how the woman was rescued, it's believed that she was being smuggled by a man who crashed the car, resulting in it catching fire.

125.title: Can't please everybody, not an avocado: Malaika on fashion choices
125.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora, on being asked about her fashion choices, said that she can't please everybody, adding that she is not an avocado. "When I was younger I was far more experimental and some of those experiments turned out terrible," she added. The actress gave the interview hours before getting hospitalised following a car accident on Saturday.

126.title: Man arrested for raping 16-yr-old disabled girl in Delhi
126.article_body: Police have arrested a man for allegedly raping a 16-year-old disabled girl in Delhi, officials said on Sunday. "A PCR call was received around 8.45 am on Saturday at Mahendra Park Police Station, stating that a teenage girl has been raped in the area, following which the police rushed to the spot," an official said.

127.title: Saddened by the way Delhi bungalow was vacated: Chirag Paswan
127.article_body: LJP leader Chirag Paswan said he was saddened by the way the government bungalow in Delhi allotted to his father late Ram Vilas Paswan was vacated. "I never said that I want 12, Janpath forever. My family respects the law," Chirag Paswan said. "We were ready to vacate the house but why were we humiliated like this?" Paswan added.

128.title: Pak's Punjab Assembly adjourned without voting to elect new CM
128.article_body: A session of Pakistan's Punjab Assembly was adjourned till April 6 on Sunday without voting to elect the new Chief Minister. PML-Q's Chaudhry Parvez Elahi, one of the contenders for the CM's post, claimed the session was adjourned following an "attack" by the opposition lawmakers on MPAs of the ruling party. This comes amid a political crisis in Pakistan.

129.title: Shanghai asks 26 mn citizens to self-test for COVID as China sees highest cases in 2 yrs
129.article_body: Shanghai has ordered its 26 million residents to undergo two more rounds of tests for COVID-19. Residents should self-test on Sunday using antigen kits and report any positive results, while a nucleic acid test would be conducted on Monday. China on Sunday reported over 13,000 new COVID-19 cases, the highest since the peak of the first wave in February 2020.

130.title: Vicky remembers Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw on his birth anniversary
130.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal took to his Instagram Stories on Sunday to remember Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw on his 108th birth anniversary. He shared a picture of the Field Marshal, who's popularly known as 'Sam Bahadur'. "Remembering Sam Bahadur," he wrote, with some folded hands emojis. Vicky will play Field Marshal Sam Manekshaw in an upcoming biopic, titled 'Sam Bahadur'.

131.title: Economic jihad by K'taka CM will ensure we don't get jobs: Cong MLA
131.article_body: Karnataka Congress MLA Priyank Kharge said "economic jihad" by CM Basavaraj Bommai's party "will ensure that we neither get investments [nor] jobs". This comes after Bengaluru-based Khatabook Founder Ravish Naresh said the city's HSR/Koramangala area has bad roads and poor quality water supply. Telangana Minister KTR Rao later replied to Naresh's tweet and asked him to move to Hyderabad.

132.title: Gauri Khan share pics with Farah, says 'Never a dull moment with her'
132.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's wife, interior designer Gauri Khan shared few pictures with choreographer-director Farah Khan on Instagram. One of the pictures, showed Farah holding Gauri from behind. Praising Farah, Gauri captioned the post, "Never a dull moment hanging with Farah...Love her cinema and her humour." According to reports, Farah and Gauri have collaborated for a new show.

133.title: It was the biggest blockbuster of 1992: Anil celebrates 30 yrs of 'Beta'
133.article_body: Anil Kapoor on Sunday shared a post on Instagram marking the 30th anniversary of his film 'Beta'. He shared a series of photos, where he and Madhuri Dixit were seen receiving an award for the movie. "It was a great feeling for us as actors when our film was the biggest blockbuster of...1992 and received so much love," Anil wrote.

134.title: Malaika returns to home from hospital after suffering injuries in car accident
134.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora has returned to her Mumbai home after suffering injuries in a car accident on the Mumbai-Pune highway on Saturday. The actress was discharged from the hospital on Sunday morning. "The actress suffered minor injuries on her forehead; CT scan has turned out fine & she is currently okay," Apollo Hospital had said on Saturday night.

135.title: Man who said he accidentally kissed woman in Mumbai train jailed for 1 year
135.article_body: A man from Goa was sentenced to one-year rigorous imprisonment after being found guilty of kissing a woman on her cheek on a Mumbai local train in 2015. The man claimed his lips inadvertently touched her cheek after he was pushed by a commuter and fell on her. The court rejected his defence, saying women are "perceptive" about such things.

136.title: Those involved in rioting won't be spared: Rajasthan CM on Karauli incident
136.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has assured strict action against those responsible for communal clashes that broke out in Karauli on Saturday. "Those involved in inciting riots will not be spared and stringent action will be taken against them. Rule of law will be followed in the state," Gehlot added. Section 144 was imposed in the area following the incident.

137.title: Left Kashmir due to extremism, will go back as Bharat Bhakt: RSS chief
137.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that Kashmiri Pandits left the valley due to extremism. "But when we'll return now...we'll go back as Hindus & 'Bharat Bhakt' with...an assurance of our security and livelihood. We'll live in way...that nobody will dare to displace us," he said, adding, "Kashmiri Pandits [are] bearing brunt of getting displaced from...home in...own country for...last 3-4 decades."

138.title: SDM booked after clerk beaten to death in UP’s Pratapgarh
138.article_body: The sub-divisional magistrate (SDM) of Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh, Gyanendra Vikram Singh, has been booked in connection with the death of a tehsil clerk. The family of the 57-year-old victim, Sunil Kumar Sharma, has alleged that he died after being severely beaten up by Singh and a few others. The case was registered against the SDM after the government employees protested.

139.title: Late rapper Tupac's love letters to girl named Cosima sold at auction for over $50,000
139.article_body: Late rapper Tupac Shakur's love letters to a girl named Cosima have been sold at an auction for over $50,000. Tupac and Cosima had met in October 1988, when the rapper was 17 years old. All of the letters, written in 1988-1999 were signed at the end with "Thinking of U! Eternally your friend, Tupac A Shakur".

140.title: Ensure animals are stunned before slaughtering them in B'luru: K'taka govt
140.article_body: The Karnataka Animal Husbandry and Veterinary Services Department has asked the Bengaluru civic body to ensure animals are mandatorily stunned before they are slaughtered for meat. The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has also been asked to check the stunning facility while issuing licences for slaughterhouses and chicken shops. The directions come amid the 'halal' meat controversy.

141.title: I'm gay, thought I'd never ever come out: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael
141.article_body: Comedian Jerrod Carmichael has come out in his comedy special 'Rothaniel', saying, "I had a secret...I kept from my...family...friends... Professionally, personally. And that secret is that I'm gay." Jerrod further said he rebelled against it his whole life and thought he'd "never ever come out". "At many points I thought I'd rather die than...actually say it to people," he added.

142.title: Varun Sood, Divya Agarwal spotted for the first time post breakup, pics surface
142.article_body: Divya Agarwal and Varun Sood were spotted in the city together for the first time post their breakup. The former couple was seen together at a footwear sale event which also had a live DJ set at night. Several pictures surfaced online, where Varun is seen protecting Divya from the crowd as they made their way to the event.

143.title: Bowling partners make things easy for me: GT pacer Lockie Ferguson
143.article_body: After picking up four wickets against Delhi Capitals on Saturday, Gujarat Titans pacer Lockie Ferguson said that his "bowling partners make things very easy" for him. "It's great (to have a potent bowling unit) and helps to spread calmness in the group. The pressure was coming from both ends with the ball and it worked for us," Ferguson said.

144.title: Will hold 5-pronged protest against Centre over paddy procurement: TRS Min
144.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi Minister KT Rama Rao has said that his party is going to hold a five-pronged protest against the BJP-led Centre across Telangana over the ongoing paddy procurement issue in the state. Different forms of protests including the blocking of national highways will take place on April 4, 6, 7, 8 and 11, Rao said.

145.title: Getting married didn't matter for me; Siddharth changed my perspective: Vidya
145.article_body: Vidya Balan has revealed that earlier she felt being in a live-in relationship or marriage didn't matter.  She added that now she appreciates marriage because of her husband Siddharth Roy Kapur and he changed her perspective. "I feel blessed to have him as my partner. He accepts me the way I'm, on my good days and bad days," Vidya said.

146.title: Over 90% people satisfied with Mohalla clinics: Delhi govt survey
146.article_body: Around 93% of the patients that visit the Aam Aadmi Mohalla clinics in Delhi are satisfied with its services, according to a Delhi government survey. A patient spends an average of 9.92 minutes to meet the doctor and 8.35 minutes to collect medicines at the clinic. Around 116 patient visits were recorded per Mohalla clinic per day in 2021.

147.title: Maharashtra Police make monkey drink water from bottle, video surfaces
147.article_body: Maharashtra Police made a monkey drink water from a bottle. The video of the incident went viral on social media. "Salute to Maharashtra Police for the kindness and compassion towards voiceless babies," an Instagram user wrote while sharing the video. Several users dropped hearts in the comments section of the video.

148.title: Rachakonda Police share QR code for recruitment training enrolment
148.article_body: Hyderabad’s Rachakonda Police have shared a QR code on Twitter for aspirants seeking pre-recruitment training to enrol in police. Eligible aspirants residing within Rachakonda limits, who wish to apply for Telangana Police jobs, including roles of sub-inspector and police constable, can scan code and apply for free integrated coaching, police said. The last date to apply is April 5.

149.title: Sri Lankan Navy apprehends 12 Indian fishermen, impounds boat near Delft island
149.article_body: The Sri Lankan Navy on Sunday apprehended 12 Indian fishermen and impounded one boat for allegedly fishing near Delft island. The fishermen had gone out to sea in 530 mechanised boats on Saturday. This comes amid an economic crisis in the neighbouring country, due to which the Sri Lankan Navy has increased patrolling activities to avoid its nationals from escaping.

150.title: Shooting next film in Iran, will take mom along: John Abraham
150.article_body: Actor John Abraham has stated that he'll be shooting his next film 'Tehran' in Iran, adding he would probably be the first Indian actor to shoot there. "My mom has got 21 cousins in Iran and I want to take her along," he said. John added that 'Tehran' is in the geopolitical space of 'Madras Cafe', 'Batla House' and 'Parmanu'.

151.title: Nepal becomes 4th country to launch India's e-payment system RuPay
151.article_body: Nepal on Saturday became the fourth country in the world to operationalise India's e-payment system RuPay. The three other countries that have the RuPay card are Bhutan, Singapore and the United Arab Emirates. The Indian External Affairs Ministry said the launch of the card in Nepal would open new vistas for cooperation in financial connectivity and further strengthen people-to-people linkages.

152.title: Delhi-Meerut rail corridor to be designed to handle medical emergencies
152.article_body: The stations and train coaches of the rapid rail corridor between Delhi, Ghaziabad and Meerut will be designed to handle health emergencies. "Lifts will be big enough to accommodate stretchers, wheelchairs and people, like in hospitals...in rapid rail any person can reach Delhi-NCR's big hospitals...in 55 minutes without traffic...or extra charges usually spent on ambulances," an official said.

153.title: Newlyweds, friend drown in river while clicking selfies in Maha
153.article_body: A newly married couple and their friend drowned as they were allegedly clicking selfies in a village in Maharashtra's Beed, police said on Sunday. "The trio drowned while trying to save each other," an official said. The three deceased's bodies had been fished out of the river a day earlier, the official added. Three accidental death reports have been filed.

154.title: After Raj's remark, Hanuman Chalisa played on Mumbai loudspeakers
154.article_body: A day after MNS chief Raj Thackeray demanded removal of loudspeakers in mosques, Hanuman Chalisa was played on loudspeakers at the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena office in Mumbai's Ghatkopar. "I am warning now...Remove loudspeakers or else will put loudspeakers in front of the mosque and play Hanuman Chalisa," Thackeray had said.

155.title: Talk of stagflation in India is 'overhyped': NITI Aayog VC
155.article_body: India is on the cusp of a major economic recovery and talks of possible stagflation are "overhyped", said NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar. "I am sure that the RBI is well in control of [inflation] and will take necessary steps if and when required," Kumar said. Despite the Russia-Ukraine war, "India will remain the fastest growing economy", he added.

156.title: Pune Police busts an IPL betting racket, seize ₹27 lakh, 8 phones
156.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Police have arrested three people after busting an IPL betting racket at Kalewadi on Saturday night. The police seized ₹27 lakh and eight cell phones from the accused, who were betting on the match between Delhi Capitals and Gujarat Titans, which was being played at the MCA stadium in Pune.

157.title: Drug cultivation banned in world's biggest opium producer Afghanistan by Taliban
157.article_body: The Taliban has banned the cultivation of narcotics in Afghanistan, the world's biggest opium producer. The authorities said that if anyone violated the decree, the crop will be destroyed immediately and the violator will be treated according to Sharia law. Apart from this, the production, use or transportation of other narcotics has also been banned.

158.title: My wedding should be drama-free; there's enough drama in my work life: Taapsee
158.article_body: Taapsee Pannu said that she wants a "single-day wedding affair" in tasteful nude and other subtle colours. She added, "It needs to be basic and drama-free because there's enough drama in my professional life, and I don't want it to trickle down into my personal life." Taapsee further said that she doesn't want any late night rites at her wedding.

159.title: Not bowling Moeen in 19th over was a mistake: Kaif on CSK's loss vs LSG
159.article_body: Following CSK's six-wicket loss against LSG in IPL 2022, Mohammad Kaif said not giving 19th over to Moeen Ali was a mistake, adding it wasn't skipper Ravindra Jadeja's decision. "He [Jadeja] is still learning. Even now, decisions are taken by MS Dhoni," he added. With 34 runs needed off last 12 balls, Shivam Dube conceded 25 runs in 19th over.

160.title: Good thing that Hardik took the new ball with Shami vs DC: Jaffer
160.article_body: Ex-India batter Wasim Jaffer said he was "very impressed" with Gujarat Titans captain Hardik Pandya's bowling during the match against Delhi Capitals in the IPL 2022. "The pace was up...he was touching 140 [kmph]...[it was a] good thing...he took the new ball with (Mohammad) Shami," Jaffer added. Hardik conceded 22 runs in his bowling spell and scalped one wicket.

161.title: Delhi Capitals need to improve batting in powerplay: Ricky Ponting
161.article_body: Delhi Capitals head coach Ricky Ponting said his team needs to improve the batting performance during the powerplay. "If you are losing three wickets in the powerplay, it's really hard to win games from there...That's certainly one area that we got to get better at, getting through that powerplay," he added. Gujarat Titans defeated Delhi Capitals by 14 runs.

162.title: Ambulance with patient runs out of fuel in UP, dragged to fuel station
162.article_body: An ambulance that was on its way with a patient to Uttar Pradesh's Meerut allegedly ran out of fuel mid-way. A tractor then dragged the ambulance to the nearest fuel station. Chief Medical Officer of Meerut Dr Akhilesh Mohan said that the ambulance was not from Meerut and was coming from Bijnor when the incident took place.

163.title: MP CM asks hotel owners in Ujjain to use Hindi signboards instead of English
163.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has asked hotel owners in Ujjain, an ancient city, to use Hindi signboards instead of English. "Our academic development will happen only with the growth of our language," he said. Chouhan added that the practice of begging on Ujjain's streets should be stopped and a mass feast should be held regularly for the poor.

164.title: Grammys 2022 to have special segment dedicated to Ukraine
164.article_body: The 64th Grammy Awards will have a special segment dedicated to Ukraine's ongoing crisis amid the war with Russia. "We're heartbroken by...situation in Ukraine, yet still moved by the resilient spirit on display there every day," Recording Academy CEO Harvey Mason Jr said, adding, "We hope the segment inspires our audience to get involved to support critical humanitarian efforts."

165.title: Ex-UN prosecutor calls for global arrest warrant against Putin
165.article_body: A former prosecutor of UN war crimes tribunals, Carla Del Ponte, has called for a global arrest warrant for Russian President Vladimir Putin over the war in Ukraine. "Putin is a war criminal," she said. "These dead people have loved ones who don't even know what's become of them. That is unacceptable," she said of mass graves in Ukraine.

166.title: Law of land prevails in Maharashtra: Sanjay Raut on Raj Thackeray’s remark
166.article_body: The law of the land prevails in Maharashtra and the state Home Minister will do everything as per the law, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said on Sunday. His statement came in reaction to MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s comment to remove the loudspeakers from mosques. "People thought it (Raj Thackeray's event) was BJP's event," Raut added.

167.title: Indore zoo arranges ACs, water coolers for animals amid rising temperatures
167.article_body: In view of the rising temperatures, arrangements have been made for coolers, ACs and sprinklers at Indore’s Kamla Nehru Zoological Garden to provide respite to animals from the heat. "The water bodies and coolers have been installed for tiger, lion, leopard…Piped water is also being sprayed," Zoo in-charge, Dr Uttam Yadav, said.

168.title: US makes 40 miles per gallon mileage must for new vehicles by 2026
168.article_body: By 2026, all new vehicles sold in the US must deliver a mileage of at least 49 miles per gallon, the government has ordered. Currently, the minimum mileage required for vehicles stands at 28 mpg. The administration said the new rules are the strongest to date, which will save over 220 billion gallons of gasoline over the lives of vehicles.

169.title: Saisha Shinde returns to 'Lock Upp' after apology to Kangana
169.article_body: Designer Saisha Shinde, who was eliminated from reality show 'Lock Upp' following an argument with host Kangana Ranaut, has returned to the show. A promo shows her reentering the jail while dancing to the song 'Bole Chudiyan Bole Kangana'. This comes after Saisha took to Instagram to apologise to Kangana saying she just wanted to be a version of her.

170.title: Russian airstrikes hit 'critical infrastructure' near Odessa port
170.article_body: The Russian military on Sunday carried out strikes on "critical infrastructure" near Ukraine's Odessa. An oil processing plant and fuel depots around the strategic Black Sea port were targeted in the attack. A Russian Defense Ministry spokesman said Russian ships and aircraft fired missiles on Sunday to strike the facilities that were used to provide fuel to Ukrainian troops.

171.title: Nice 'take your husband to work day' for Healy: Jaffer on Starc cheering for her
171.article_body: Former India opener Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter to share picture of Mitchell Starc cheering for his wife and fellow cricketer Alyssa Healy in Australia's 2022 Women's World Cup final against England. Starc was seen giving Healy a standing ovation after she reached the three-figure mark. "Pretty nice 'take your husband to work day' for Healy," wrote Jaffer.

172.title: 'Adipurush' will depict 'Parakrama' side of Lord Ram: Director Om Raut
172.article_body: Director Om Raut spoke about his upcoming film 'Adipurush',  an adaptation of 'Ramayana', and said, "Ramayana has always had a strong influence since ages. I'm depicting the 'Parakrama' (splendour and magnificence) side of Ram." He added that shooting with Prabhas and Saif Ali Khan has been a great experience. 'Adipurush' will feature Prabhas as Lord Ram and Saif as Ravan.

173.title: Ex-Bengaluru Police chief Bhaskar Rao quits, likely to join AAP
173.article_body: Former Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao's resignation has been accepted by the  Karnataka government. Rao, who was presently serving as the Additional Director General of Police, is likely to join the AAP on Monday. The 1990-batch IPS officer had cited personal reasons for the resignation. He was the city police chief between 2019 and 2020.

174.title: WHO suspends UN supply of Covaxin COVID-19 vaccine
174.article_body: The WHO has suspended the supply through United Nations agencies of Covaxin, the COVID-19 vaccine produced by India's Bharat Biotech. Reuters and Bloomberg reported that the suspension is to allow the manufacturer to upgrade facilities and address deficiencies found in an inspection. "The WHO said the vaccine is effective and no safety concerns exist," the reports added.

175.title: Putin using body double to avoid being assassinated amid Ukraine war: Report
175.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin is reportedly using a body double to foil any assassination attempts amid the ongoing invasion of Ukraine. As per a report, his body double has also been trained to walk in the same manner as Putin and is also present at Kremlin meetings. He is also said to be living in the same Presidential complex.

176.title: I like Tilak Varma's temperament, he isn't scared of big names: Shastri
