351.article_body: A man in the UK's Derby crashed his brand new Ferrari worth around ₹2.5 crore just after buying it. Photos shared by police show the front bonnet crumpled with scratches all across the front of the car. "Driver bought a Ferrari this morning and crashed it after driving it less than 2 miles. No injuries. #DriveToArrive," police wrote.

352.title: What is known about the new COVID-19 variant 'XE' that WHO has warned against?
352.article_body: WHO has issued a warning against the 'XE' variant of COVID-19, which is a hybrid of two sublineages of the Omicron variant- BA.1 and BA.2. First detected in the UK on January 19, the 'XE' variant's rate of infection has been found in preliminary studies to be 10% higher than that of BA.2 (considered most contagious till now), WHO said.

353.title: Delhi & Punjab done, ready for Guj: Mann in roadshow with Kejriwal
353.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal held a roadshow in Ahmedabad ahead of Gujarat Assembly polls scheduled for later this year. "Delhi and Punjab sorted, now we are ready for Gujarat," Mann said. Kejriwal claimed he ended corruption in Delhi. "I don't know how to do politics but...know how to end corruption," he said.

354.title: Chris Rock's fan shouts 'f**k Will Smith' during his show, comedian replies 'No, no'
354.article_body: Comedian Chris Rock stopped a fan who was abusing Will Smith during a live performance in Boston on Thursday, according to People magazine. "No, no, no, no, no," Chris Rock immediately replied. At Rock's shows on Wednesday, his first appearance since presenting at the Academy Awards where he was slapped by Smith, he said he was "still processing what happened".

355.title: At least 35 killed in strike on Ukraine's Mykolaiv: Governor
355.article_body: At least 35 people were killed in a rocket strike on a regional administration building in Ukraine's Mykolaiv. Reportedly, rescue workers have continued to dismantle the rubble and search for victims after the rocket strike. Meanwhile, at least 1,276 civilians including 115 children were killed in Ukraine since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

356.title: Cameraman gets hit by six from MI's Tilak Varma, Trent Boult's reaction goes viral
356.article_body: Mumbai Indians batting all-rounder Tilak Varma smashed a six over long-off on the bowling of Rajasthan Royals' Riyan Parag, which went on to hit a cameraman. The reaction of RR fast bowler Trent Boult, who was fielding at long-off, went viral. Boult was seen putting hands on his head before checking up on the cameraman.

357.title: 5-time champions MI lose two matches in a row as RR register 2nd straight win
357.article_body: Rajasthan Royals (RR) defeated five-time champions Mumbai Indians (MI) by 23 runs to register their second straight win in IPL 2022. MI have now lost their first two matches in IPL 2022. The match witnessed RR opener Jos Buttler becoming the first batter to slam a hundred in IPL 2022. Buttler scored 100(68), including 11 fours and five sixes.

358.title: Ready-to-eat popcorn to attract 18% GST, clarifies Telangana AAR
358.article_body: Ready-to-eat popcorn is prepared by swelling maize corn and should attract 18% GST, Telangana Authority for Advanced Ruling (AAR) has clarified. It noted that ready-to-eat popcorn falls under the category of prepared foods obtained by swelling or roasting of cereals or cereal products. It "clearly does not fall under" the category pertaining to preparations of vegetables, fruits, nuts, it added.

359.title: How's the Jos, very high sir: Mishra after Buttler hit 1st ton of IPL 2022
359.article_body: Following RR opener Jos Buttler's 68-ball 100 against MI in IPL 2022, ex-DC spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "How's the Jos...high, very high sir! A deadly display of batting by Buttler, just like we all expect him to do." He added, "First century of IPL 2022. Heart goes out for the bowlers who have to bowl him in such scorching heat."

360.title: South Africa crosses 1 lakh COVID-19 deaths since pandemic began
360.article_body: South Africa's National Institute for Communicable Diseases on Friday said the country reported 1,00,020 deaths since the pandemic began. However, the government still plans to lift the lockdown restrictions soon. Deputy President David Mabuza said government has no plans to introduce a mandatory COVID-19 vaccine policy in the country. Meanwhile, South Africa logged 1,692 cases on Friday.

361.title: Sudan's miltary leader who led coup threatens to expel UN envoy
361.article_body: Sudan's military leader General Abdel Fattah al-Burhan on Friday threatened to expel UN special representative Volker Perthes, accusing him of overstepping the mandate. "We heard his slander the other day, lying, blatantly lying," said al-Burhan. This comes after Perthes warned Sudan was heading for "an economic and security collapse". Sudan plunged into crisis after last year's military coup.

362.title: Israeli troops kill 3 Palestinians in a raid in occupied West Bank
362.article_body: Israeli forces on Saturday said three members of Palestinian Islamic Jihad were killed during a raid in the occupied West Bank near the city of Jenin. As per a statement by the Israeli police, three Palestinians were killed when they opened fire on Israeli troops leading to a shoot-out. They added that four soldiers were wounded in the operation.

363.title: Becoming director as you're not good-looking to be star not a reason: Karan
363.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has condemned those who become directors because they weren't "good-looking enough" to become movie stars. "That cannot be the reason why you are a director. It cannot be your plan B," the filmmaker added. He further said that aspiring directors must be familiar with the work of great directors like Pedro Almodóvar, SS Rajamouli and Steven Spielberg.

364.title: Mali's military kills over 200 Islamic militants in Moura region
364.article_body: Mali's military on Friday said they killed 203 Islamic militants during an operation carried out in Moura region in March. "This operation follows very precise information that made it possible to locate the holding of a meeting between various militants in Moura," a military statement said. The military added they arrested 51 people and seized large quantities of weapons too.

365.title: We seek to expand relations with US: Pak Army chief after PM's 'foreign conspiracy' claim
365.article_body: Pakistan's army chief General Qamar Javed Bajwa has said his country sought to expand its relationship with US, a day after Pakistan protested to the US embassy over alleged interference in its internal affairs. PM Imran Khan had said that Pakistan gave a protest note to the embassy over what he described as foreign conspiracy to oust him from power.

366.title: Hopefully I can put on a display for DC fans: Powell ahead of DC vs GT
366.article_body: Ahead of Delhi Capitals-Gujarat Titans in IPL 2022, DC batter Rovman Powell, who was out for a duck in his side's first match, said he's looking forward to scoring some runs. "Hopefully, I can put on a display for the Delhi Capitals fans," he added. The match will be played today at Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune.

367.title: DC to field first against GT, playing XIs announced
367.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) captain Rishabh Pant won the toss and elected to field first against GT in their IPL 2022 match at the Maharashtra Cricket Association Stadium, Pune. GT are fielding the same playing XI, while Kamlesh Nagarkoti has been replaced by Mustafizur Rahman in DC's playing XI. Notably, both the teams had won their opening matches in IPL 2022.

368.title: Akshay Kumar was never approached for 'The Kashmir Files': Producer
368.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' producer Abhishek Agarwal has revealed that actor Akshay Kumar was never approached for the film. He further said neither he nor director Vivek Agnihotri thought about the commercial aspect of the film, adding that the cast features performers and not stars. "Vivek was...very specific so we brought Darshan (Kumaar) on board [to portray Krishna Pandit]," Abhishek added.

369.title: My directorial debut 'F.A.L.T.U' was a big deal for me: Remo
369.article_body: Choreographer-director Remo D'souza has stated that his directorial debut 'F.A.L.T.U' was a big deal for him in many ways. He further said that the word 'faltu' (useless) was attached to him since he was young. "It was my way of telling...naysayers that no life choice made by anyone is ever 'faltu' especially when those are the unconventional ones," Remo added.

370.title: Cyberabad Police announces short film contest on drug abuse theme
370.article_body: The Cyberabad Police has announced a short film contest on the theme 'Spreading Awareness on Drug Abuse'. Sharing the registration link on Twitter, the force informed that participants can submit 60 to 120 second-long videos in English, Hindi or Telugu with subtitles. The first prize winner will get ₹50,000 while second and third will receive ₹30,000 and ₹20,000 respectively.

371.title: Restoration of Hyderabad's Kali Kaman completed, pictures released
371.article_body: The restoration work at Kali Kaman, one of the four arches near Hyderabad's Charminar, has been completed. The before and after photos of the Kaman were shared on Twitter by Telangana Special Chief Secretary, Municipal Administration, Arvind Kumar on Saturday. The project was undertaken by the municipal corporation and Telangana Heritage Department last year and reportedly cost ₹1.48 crore.

372.title: Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray flags off Metro lines 2A and 7 in Mumbai
372.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray inaugurated two Metro lines in Mumbai on the occasion of Gudi Padwa on Saturday. The lines will begin full operations on April 3 with Metro 2A, running from Dahisar west to DN Nagar and Metro 7, from Dahisar east to Andheri east. There are around 60 drivers to operate the trains, MMRDA Commissioner, SVR Srinivas, said.

373.title: Manipur to honour Irom Sharmila for 16-yr-long anti-AFSPA movement
373.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh has said the state government will honour Irom Chanu Sharmila for her 16-year-long hunger strike against the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA). "I...appreciate...Sharmila who sacrificed half of her life staging dharna," Singh said. She started her hunger strike in 2000 after 10 civilians were allegedly killed by security forces. Her strike ended in 2016.

374.title: Himalaya clarifies on its halal policy after users call for #BoycottHimalaya
374.article_body: Himalaya on Friday issued a statement after a group of people started to call for #BoycottHimalaya over its halal policy. The company said, "None of the Himalaya products contain meat, as alleged in some of the social media platforms; this is factually incorrect." It added, that halal certification "does not imply that a product contains animal-derived ingredients."

375.title: ₹1.29 cr siphoned off from dead doctor's bank account in Mumbai
375.article_body: Two former housekeeping staff members of the SBI Goregaon branch allegedly siphoned off ₹1.29 crore from the bank account of a Kolkata-based doctor, who had died in 2014. The accused, who reportedly entered the bank during the lockdown on the pretext of cleaning, accessed the bank's systems, updated KYC and changed the mobile number linked to the account.

376.title: Mumbai's 'Sunday Streets' to be hosted at 3 more locations
376.article_body: After 'Sunday Streets' was held at six locations in the city last week, Mumbai Police decided to add three more roads that will be made traffic-free for a few hours every Sunday. From April 3, people will also be able to engage in fun activities on streets of Chembur's Chimni garden, Dahisar's IC Colony and Kandivali's Thakur Village.

377.title: 4-team series involving India, Pakistan can bring in revenue of ₹5,000 crore: PCB
377.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) said their proposed four-team T20I tournament involving India, Pakistan, England and Australia can bring in revenue of around ₹5,000 crore for the four participants as well as the ICC. Pakistan will formally present the proposal at the ICC Board meeting next week in Dubai. "It will become a much-anticipated event," a PCB official told ESPNcricinfo.

378.title: 7 bus drivers fined on 1st day of lane discipline drive in Delhi
378.article_body: Seven drivers of DTC and cluster buses were fined ₹10,000 each on Friday, the first day of the lane discipline enforcement drive. The first violation will attract a fine of ₹10,000, the second will invite prosecution under the Motor Vehicles Act, the third will get the driving licence suspended and the fourth will lead to termination of the vehicle's permit.

379.title: I grew up watching Ajay Devgn, he was superstar then & now: Jr NTR
379.article_body: Actor Jr NTR has stated that he has grown up watching actor Ajay Devgn's films. "He was our very own action superstar then and he is now," the actor added. He further said that Ajay's entry standing on two bikes in 'Phool Aur Kaante' was crazy for him, adding that he used to wonder if he can do it.

380.title: Aren't your words extreme? Jungkook to troll saying 'Eat dog sh*t'
380.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS' member Jungkook held an 'ask me anything' session on Instagram during which a social media user wrote, "Are you bored? Eat dog sh*t." Jungkook responded to the user writing, "Aren't your words really extreme? If you crumble up choco pie, the shape looks similar." He is quarantined in Las Vegas after testing positive for COVID-19.

381.title: Sri Lanka imposes nationwide curfew till Monday amid economic crisis
381.article_body: The Sri Lankan government on Saturday imposed a nationwide curfew until Monday morning amid growing unrest in the country due to a severe economic crisis. Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa had imposed a state of emergency earlier this week after public protests over the crisis turned violent. The crisis has led to a shortage of essential items in the country.

382.title: Joss the boss: Harbhajan on Buttler being 1st player to hit 100 in IPL 2022
382.article_body: After Jos Buttler became the first player to score a century in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh took to Twitter and said, "Joss the boss...what a 100 Buttler, class." The RR opener scored 100 off 68 balls against MI at DY Patil Stadium, Mumbai. He hit 11 fours and five sixes during his ton. RR scored 193/8 in 20 overs.

383.title: Akhilesh Yadav's uncle Shivpal starts following PM, UP CM on Twitter
383.article_body: Amid reports of a rift with his nephew and SP President Akhilesh Yadav, PSPL chief Shivpal Yadav on Saturday started following PM Narendra Modi and Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Twitter. Notably, this comes after Yadav met CM Adityanath in Lucknow on Wednesday. Earlier, Yadav had claimed he was not invited to the SP Legislature Party meeting.

384.title: Employee holding civil post has to act with utmost good faith: SC
384.article_body: Supreme Court has said that an employee desirous of holding a civil post has to act with utmost good faith and truthfulness. The remarks came as the court upheld the sacking of a teacher for not disclosing a criminal case registered against him in the official forms. The man had joined as a trained graduate teacher of mathematics in Delhi.

385.title: Oscars Academy accepts Smith's resignation, to continue with disciplinary proceedings
385.article_body: David Rubin, president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, has said that the Academy has accepted Will Smith's resignation following the Oscars slapping incident. "We'll continue to move forward with our disciplinary proceedings against Mr Smith for violations of the Academy's Standards of Conduct, in advance of our next scheduled board meeting on April 18," he added.

386.title: Scientists to send pic depicting naked man & woman to space for aliens
386.article_body: Scientists have developed a binary-coded new message, which includes a representation of naked man and woman, that will be beamed to aliens that might exist in the Milky Way. "The proposed message includes basic mathematical and physical concepts...The message concludes with digitised images of the human form, along with an invitation for any receiving intelligences to respond," they said.

387.title: PM Modi gifts miniature painting from Himachal to Nepal PM Deuba, pic released
387.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has gifted a miniature painting from Himachal Pradesh to Nepalese PM Sher Bahadur Deuba, during the latter's first visit to India as PM. The traditional 'Pahari School' painting depicts the season of monsoon. It shows Lord Krishna and Radha holding hands and it's representative of the painting style that originated in Kangra.

388.title: Ariana Grande pledges to donate $1.5mn to fight anti-trans bills
388.article_body: Singer Ariana Grande has pledged to match up to $1.5 million (almost ₹11.4 crore) in donations to LGBTQ advocacy groups amid the anti-trans rights bills in the US state legislature. She wrote on Instagram, "Right now there are hundreds of disgraceful bills pending in state legislature that target trans youth and aim to curb their rights."

389.title: Imposter befriends Mumbai woman on Facebook, cheats her of ₹15 lakh
389.article_body: An imposter allegedly defrauded a 42-year-old Mumbai businesswoman of ₹15.6 lakh. The accused reportedly posed as a UK businessman on Facebook initially and told the victim he was sending a gift. He later called her pretending to be a customs official and asked her to pay a penalty against the gift and $70,000 that had arrived at the airport.

390.title: Pradeep Mehra receives ₹2.5 lakh from Shoppers Stop, Kapri shares post
390.article_body: Shoppers Stop has given a cheque of ₹2.5 lakh to 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra for his mother’s treatment and to accomplish his dream of joining the Indian Army. Filmmaker Vinod Kapri tweeted about this and wrote, "Midnight runner Pradeep Mehra is overwhelmed with all the love and support." Earlier in March, Mehra's video of running in Noida had gone viral.

391.title: Commendable: Raina on GT skipper Hardik's comeback as bowler in IPL
391.article_body: Calling Hardik Pandya's comeback as a bowler in his side's five-wicket win against LSG in IPL 2022 "commendable", ex-CSK player Suresh Raina said GT skipper is looking fit. Irfan Pathan praised Hardik and said he's not putting much strain on his back as he's not trying to bend a lot while releasing the ball. Hardik registered bowling figures of 4-0-37-0.

392.title: 6-yr-old girl on picnic dies after she slips & falls into pool in Mumbai
392.article_body: A six-year-old girl, who was on a picnic with her family, died after she slipped and drowned in a swimming pool on the eve of Gudi-Padwa at a private bungalow in Uttan near Mumbai. According to police, the deceased girl's parents were having breakfast when the incident took place. Meanwhile, police have registered an accidental death report into the matter.

393.title: Cooperation in Space possible only after removal of sanctions: Russia
393.article_body: Roscosmos Director General Dmitry Rogozin on Saturday said restoration of normal relations between the partners at the International Space Station (ISS) and other projects would be possible only once Western sanctions against Moscow are lifted. He added that plans to end cooperation over ISS with space agencies of US, Canada, EU and Japan will soon be reported to Russian authorities.

394.title: India to export 40,000 tonnes of rice to Sri Lanka amid its economic crisis
394.article_body: India is set to export 40,000 tonnes of rice to Sri Lanka amid the latter’s economic crisis. The 40,000-tonne shipment is part of the 3,00,000 tonnes India will supply to Sri Lanka in the next few months. Notably, Sri Lanka has announced a state of emergency after violent protests erupted over food and fuel shortages in the country.

395.title: US sanctions 5 North Korean firms over recent ballistic missile tests
395.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on five North Korean entities for supporting "North Korea's development of weapons of mass destruction and ballistic missile programmes". The move follows recent missile tests by North Korea, including its first intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) launch since 2017. "These...tests are brazen violations of multiple UN Security Council resolutions," the US said.

396.title: We expect good news over the weekend on Mariupol evacuations: Ukraine
396.article_body: Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleksiy Arestovych on Saturday said the government expects good news over the weekend regarding evacuation of the inhabitants of the besieged city of Mariupol. "Our delegation has reached an agreement in Istanbul (during Ukraine-Russia peace talks) to provide evacuations," Arestovych added. Meanwhile, at least 1,276 civilians were killed in Ukraine till March 31.

397.title: Russia registers world's first nasal COVID-19 vaccine
397.article_body: Russian Health Ministry on Friday registered world's first nasal version of Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine. Gamaleya Research Centre Director Alexander Gintsburg said the vaccine will be available within three to four months. He added that the vaccine will be efficient against Omicron variant. Meanwhile, Russia reported 17,949 new cases and 340 deaths in the last 24 hours.

398.title: India beat Wales 5-1 in their opening game of women's junior hockey WC
398.article_body: India started their FIH Hockey Women's Junior World Cup campaign with a win over Wales by 5-1 in Potchefstroom, South Africa on Saturday. The scorers for India in the Group D clash were Lalremsiami, Lalrindiki, Deepika and Mumtaz Khan. Indian captain and midfielder Salima Tete was adjudged the player of the match.

399.title: There are some nerves ahead of Women's World Cup final: Meg Lanning
399.article_body: Australia captain Meg Lanning feels that there are "some nerves" in her team's camp ahead of their ICC Women's World Cup final against England on Sunday. “There are certainly some nerves around I think it would be crazy if you weren’t nervous heading into a WC final, so it’s a good thing. But there’s a lot of excitement," Lanning said.

400.title: UN climate science panel to focus on cutting greenhouse gas emissions
400.article_body: UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) on Monday said its final report will focus on ways of curbing greenhouse gas emissions. While report is published, it will only be released after 195 governments will ratify the its findings as well as its summary. Experts warned this consensual nature of the report could diverge from the most dramatic warnings.
